intro: Oxymitra urdanetensis, commonly known as the Urdanet orchid, is a rare and endemic orchid species native to Venezuela. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique floral structure and specialized growth habits. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in rocky or forested areas. Its flowers are small and usually have a distinctive coloration, which aids in attracting specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Oxymitra urdanetensis is considered a vulnerable species.
